intro: Lophoxera caudata, commonly known as the purple coneflower, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, violet-colored petals and a distinctive, spiky central cone. The plant typically grows to a height of 2 to 4 feet and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture, while its roots are fibrous and adapted to moist, well-drained soils. Lophoxera caudata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is a valuable source of nectar for pollinators.
